cleanliness and all the refinements of life, Prince Andrew felt a pleasant sense of repose among luxurious surroundings such as he had been accustomed to from childhood. Besides it was pleasant, after his reception by the Aus- trians, to speak if not in Russian (for they were speaking French) at least with a Russian who would, he supposed, share the general Rus- sian antipathy to the Austrians which was then particularly strong.
